zone.line: In mild variety the seasons mild
With rainbow-skirted showers, & odorous winds
And long blue meteors cleansing the dull night ,
And the life-kindling shafts of the keen Sun's
All-piercing bow, & the dew-mingled rain
Of the calm moonbeams, a soft influence mild ;
Shall clothe the forests & the fields—aye even
The crag-built desarts of the barren deep
With ever-living leaves & fruits & flowers
And Thou ... there is a Cavern whence my
spirit2
Was panted forth in anguish whilst thy pain
Made my heart mad, & thou who did inhale
it
Became mad too, & built a Temple there
And spoke and were oracular, & lured
The erring nations round to mutual war
And faithless faith, such as Jove kept with
thee;
Which now floats upward as among tall weeds
A violets exhalation, & it fills
With a serener light & crimson air
Intense yet soft the rocks & woods around
